metadata.title: CVE-2019-9814 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 66. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memorycorruption and we presume that with enough effort that some of these couldbe exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox <67.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9814` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
